solution: First we factor each of these numbers: \[\sqrt{5\cdot10\cdot14\cdot21\cdot15\cdot20}=\sqrt{5\cdot(5\cdot2)(2\cdot7)(7\cdot3)(3\cdot5)(5\cdot4)}.\]Next we notice that this expression contains a lot of squares, so is equal to  \[\sqrt{5^2\cdot2^2\cdot7^2\cdot3^2\cdot5^2\cdot2^2}.\]Since the square root of a product is the product of the square roots this is equal to  \[\sqrt{5^2}\cdot\sqrt{2^2}\cdot\sqrt{7^2}\cdot\sqrt{3^2}\cdot\sqrt{5^2}\cdot\sqrt{2^2}=5\cdot2\cdot7\cdot3\cdot5\cdot2.\]Multiplying this out gives \[5\cdot2\cdot7\cdot3\cdot5\cdot2=10\cdot21\cdot10=\boxed{2100}.\]
model_solution:
## Step 1: Rewrite the expression
$\sqrt{5\cdot10\cdot14\cdot21\cdot15\cdot20} = \sqrt{5\cdot2\cdot5\cdot7\cdot2\cdot5\cdot3\cdot5\cdot2\cdot5\cdot2\cdot5}$
## Step 2: Simplify the expression
$\sqrt{5\cdot5\cdot5\cdot5\cdot2\cdot2\cdot2\cdot7\cdot2\cdot3}$
## Step 3: Group terms with the same base
$\sqrt{(5^5)\cdot(2^7)\cdot7\cdot3}$
## Step 4: Evaluate the square root
$\sqrt{(5^5)\cdot(2^7)\cdot7\cdot3} = 5^2\cdot2^3\cdot\sqrt{7\cdot3} = 25\cdot8\cdot\sqrt{21}$
## Step 5: Evaluate the square root of the remaining expression
$25\cdot8\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$
## Step 6: Simplify the square root of 21
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3\cdot7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
$200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$
## Step 7: Square the factors inside the square root
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
## Step 8: $200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3\cdot7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\sqrt{21}$
$200\cdot\sqrt{21}$
## Step 9: Simplify the expression
$200\sqrt{21}$
steps:
## Step 3: Group terms with the same base
$\sqrt{(5^5)\cdot(2^7)\cdot7\cdot3}$

## Step 5: Evaluate the square root of the remaining expression
$25\cdot8\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$

## Step 6: Simplify the square root of 21
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3\cdot7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
$200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$

## Step 7: Square the factors inside the square root
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
full_steps:
## Step 3: Group terms with the same base
$\sqrt{(5^5)\cdot(2^7)\cdot7\cdot3}$

## Step 5: Evaluate the square root of the remaining expression
$25\cdot8\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$

## Step 6: Simplify the square root of 21
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3\cdot7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
$200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{21}$

## Step 7: Square the factors inside the square root
$200\cdot\sqrt{21} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7} = 200\cdot\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
